==[[The Ten Commandments]]== {{closed|Closed as {{keep}}. [[User:Thenub314|Thenub314]] ([[User talk:Thenub314|talk]]) 15:07, 23 May 2010 (UTC)}}As per [http://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Wikibooks:Requests_for_deletion&oldid=1794200#The_Nature_of_Angelic_Beings above]. Original research and point of view problems. -- [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] <sup>[[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Adrignola|contribs]]</sup> 01:03, 13 May 2010 (UTC)
:{{Keep}} There are four content pages linked from the main page. From these, only [[The Ten Commandments/Do Not Covet]] strikes me as wholly unacceptable POV - and note the bulk of the text was not written by the same editors responsible for the rest of the book. The other pages are, in spite of being written from a Judeo-Christian perspective, quite reasonable actually. There are other annoying - but theoretically correctable - issues, such as the lack of references and the thinness of the contents. All things considered, take my position as a weak keep. --[[User:Duplode|Duplode]] ([[User talk:Duplode|talk]]) 03:59, 13 May 2010 (UTC)
:{{Keep}} I find the fact that the book attempts to address multiple religions speaks a long way to its attempt at NPOV. The fact it discusses specifics of translations without reference is very problematic. It is also quite a stalled stub, and has not received any attention for a few years. If this pattern continues I could see deleting it at some point in the future. [[User:Thenub314|Thenub314]] ([[User talk:Thenub314|talk]]) 08:43, 13 May 2010 (UTC)
:'''Delete''' - I believe that in this case a POV cleanup would be rather difficult, and giving it time to improve probably won't help much, in my opinion. [[User:Kayau|Kayau]] ( [[User talk:Kayau|talk]] | [[Special:Emailuser/Kayau|email]] | [[Special:Contributions/Kayau|contribs]] ) 10:19, 13 May 2010 (UTC) {{end closed}}

==[[:R Programming/Q&A]]== {{Closed|Closed as [[File:Symbol delete vote.svg|15px]] '''Speedy Delete'''— Consensus of book contributors. [[User:Thenub314|Thenub314]] ([[User talk:Thenub314|talk]]) 16:11, 19 May 2010 (UTC)}} [[File:Symbol delete vote.svg|15px]] '''Speedy Delete''': Unmaintained; Empty; see [[Wikibooks:Requests for deletion/Python Programming/Q&A]] & [[Wikibooks:Requests for deletion/Chess/Q&A]] --16:44, 18 May 2010 (UTC)[[User:33rogers|33rogers]] ([[User talk:33rogers|talk]])
: <del>[[File:Symbol keep vote.svg|15px]] '''Keep'''</del> Whether it's unmaintained is irrelevant. Even though it were empty (which it's not) the creator ([[User:PAC]] who has several hundred edits to [[R Programming]] and continues to [[Special:RecentChangesLinked/R_Programming|contribute]] under the username [[User:PAC2]]) saw it as useful. Since the book is still active, I suggest taking this up with the book contributors first. --[[User:Swift|Swift]] ([[User talk:Swift|talk]]) 00:22, 19 May 2010 (UTC) :: [[File:Symbol delete vote.svg|15px]] '''Delete''' as the page creator and major book contributor agrees. --[[User:Swift|Swift]] ([[User talk:Swift|talk]]) 13:38, 19 May 2010 (UTC)
I quote the User PAC here from the talk page:
<nowiki>== Speedy deletion ==</nowiki>
I agree with the speedy deletion of this page
[[User:PAC2|PAC2]] ([[User talk:PAC2|talk]]) 08:24, 17 May 2010 (UTC)
There is already consensus that Wikipedia's Reference desk is the correct place for asking questions.
My favorite quote from the last discussion ''I mean, whoever saw books automatically answering people's questions!'' by Kayau.
--[[User:33rogers|33rogers]] ([[User talk:33rogers|talk]]) 03:56, 19 May 2010 (UTC)
: Considering [[User_talk:PAC2#Request for deletion|this message]] written a couple hours ago it can only be assumed that Swift had not seen the "I agree" message from PAC2 and therefore set out to ask for his input, in perfectly good faith. No need to make a war about that... --[[User:Duplode|Duplode]] ([[User talk:Duplode|talk]]) 04:35, 19 May 2010 (UTC) :::Its hard to assume good faith, as it seemed to me Swift did not read [[Wikibooks:Requests for deletion/Python Programming/Q&A]] before opposing on all Q&A. Regardless, I will Take a break from editing ''Wikibooks:Requests_for_deletion'' for a few days. As this will be my last message here, WB:RFD, for a few days, I will take the opportunity to apologize to Swift, for any misgivings that may be construed. --[[User:33rogers|33rogers]] ([[User talk:33rogers|talk]]) 05:21, 19 May 2010 (UTC) :::: 33rogers, you're misunderstanding the point of [[WB:AGF]]. The idea is to go beyond what seems to you and assume good faith regardless. The reason for this is that based on limited information we often draw false conclusions regarding the intent of others. In some cases emotions even lead us astray and skew our rationality. :::: The trigger seems to be that you believe that I hadn't read the discussion on [[Wikibooks:Requests for deletion/Python Programming/Q&A]] before taking part in the discussion. The logical flaw in that conclusion appears to be that you believe one can only come from that discussion with one view. You furthermore make the mistaken assumption that a (prematurely closed) discussion on the deletion of a single page somehow demonstrates community consensus on where to ask questions (whether this applies only to WikiMedia projects or the wider Internet community is unclear). Quite on the contrary, there are comments noting both that these are well within scope (Adrignola) and potentially useful (Panic2k4). :::: You then seem to argue that I had ignored the note on the talk page from the user and my note on [[User talk:PAC2]] somehow supports your view that I was not acting in good faith. At this point you're not making any sense at all. :::: "''[...] I will take the opportunity to apologize to Swift, for any misgivings that may be construed.''" After your thinly veiled allegation of bad faith, don't cut your break short on my account. --[[User:Swift|Swift]] ([[User talk:Swift|talk]]) 13:38, 19 May 2010 (UTC)
Again, I agree with the deletion of the page [[:R Programming/Q&A]]. [[User:PAC2|PAC2]] ([[User talk:PAC2|talk]]) 08:30, 19 May 2010 (UTC)
'''Speedy delete''' requested by creator who is also the only notable contributor. If you don't count the person who asked a question. [[User:Kayau|Kayau]] ( [[User talk:Kayau|talk]] | [[Special:Emailuser/Kayau|email]] | [[Special:Contributions/Kayau|contribs]] ) 10:13, 19 May 2010 (UTC)
: [[File:Symbol comment vote.svg|15px]] '''Comment''' As far as I'm concerned, this now satisfies the [[WB:SPEEDY]] criteria and can be deleted without further delay but will leave that up to a less involved admin. --[[User:Swift|Swift]] ([[User talk:Swift|talk]]) 13:38, 19 May 2010 (UTC)
::Agreed and done. [[User:Thenub314|Thenub314]] ([[User talk:Thenub314|talk]]) 16:08, 19 May 2010 (UTC) {{end closed}}

revision.text:
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Stuart.halloway!
[[Image:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' about the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything, and changes can be made easily. Come [[Wikibooks:Reading room/General|introduce yourself]] to everyone, and let us know what [[Wikibooks:Reading room/Projects|interests you]]. If you're coming here from other Wikimedia projects, you should read [[Help:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|our primer for Wikimedians]] to get quickly up-to-speed.
[[Image:Icon apps query.svg|20px]] '''Getting help'''
* See the '''Wikibooks [[Help:Contents|help pages]]''' for common issues, or read [[Using Wikibooks]] for a more user-friendly introduction to the project. * Remember, every edit is saved, so if you make mistakes, you can [[Wikibooks:Reverting|revert]] to an earlier version if needed. * Get help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Files must be uploaded to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]], unless they are copyrighted and need to be uploaded here under [[w:fair use|fair use]]. If you need to upload a fair use file, you may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to do so. Please be sure to provide the required {{tlx|information}}: a [[WB:FILES|license tag]] and source are always required; fair use images require a {{tlx|fair use rationale}}.
[[Image:Transmission icon.png|20px]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[:w:Help:Edit summary|the edit summary]] and [[Help:Show preview|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[Help:Talk page|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[Image:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - modules should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only becomes available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
Thanks, [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Adrignola|contribs]] 14:38, 24 May 2010 (UTC)
(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)

This category contains templates used in the [[{{BOOKNAME}}]] book.
{{BookCat}}

'''RTOG 04-15 ([[Radiation Oncology/Prostate|PROSTATE]])''' :[[Radiation_Oncology/Prostate/RTOG_Prostate]] *''Title:'' A Phase III Randomized Study of Hypofractionated 3D-CRT/IMRT Versus Conventionally Fractionated 3D-CRT/IMRT in Patients With Favorable-Risk Prostate Cancer *''Objective:'' Compare the disease-free survival (DFS) of patients with favorable-risk stage II prostate cancer treated with hypofractionated vs conventionally fractionated three-dimensional conformal radiotherapy (3D-CRT) or intensity-modulated radiotherapy (IMRT). *''[http://rtog.org/members/protocols/0415/0415.pdf Protocol]:'' **Arm 1: 73.8 Gy in 41 fractions **Arm 2: 70 Gy in 28 fractions *''Eligibility:'' **T1-2c N0 M0, Gleason 2-6, PSA < 10 *''Enrollment Target:'' 1067 patients *''Activated:'' April 18, 2006 *''Closed:'' December 11, 2009 *[http://clinicaltrials.gov/ct2/show/NCT00331773 Clinicaltrials.gov]
{{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Quiz Options/Text Settings/Text Settings

revision.text:
==Text Settings== This section allows you to use HTML or a variety of embedded fonts (selected from a drop down box) and to select a different font or font size for your title or body text to replace the default fonts set up within the theme used. [[Image:QWText settings2.jpg|center]] ===Use HTML To Format Text=== In the '''Standard''' version of Question Writer 4 this option can be found under Quiz Properties - Appearance Settings When this option is switched on, you can change the way text is displayed by using HTML formatting. 
bold
This will make the text inside the tags bold. 
italic
This will make the text inside the tags italic. 
Arial Red at point size 24
This will make the text inside the tags point size 24, color red, font face Arial. Relative sizes can be used - eg -2,-1,+1,+2 to make the text relatively larger or smaller. Absolute sizes can be used also - eg 36. Absolute sizes smaller than 8 are treated as HTML sizes (1 is very small, 7 is very large). Font colors can be HTML colors(red, yellow, white etc) or RGB style colors (color="#FFCCFF") [[Image:QW3 Using html1.jpg|left]] [[Image:QW3 Using html2.jpg|right]] {{clear}} 
Center Alignment
This causes a new paragraph to be created and any text in that paragraph to be aligned in the center.
This creates a new line. 
superscript
E = MC2
This will make the enclosed text appear as a superscript. 
subscript
The chemical symbol for Oxygen is 02
This will make the enclosed text appear as a subscript HTML formatting can be used in all text fields with one exception - it cannot be applied to the text that appears on next and back buttons. {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" | ===Respect Newlines in HTML=== If you are using the ''' Professional''' version of Question writer you can tick this box is ticked so that you can use HTML text formatting but still respect newlines in the text. ===Optimize Text for Small Screens=== Ticking this box is especially useful for small fonts and small screens like mobile devices.{{clr}} |} ===Embed Font=== In the '''Standard''' version of Question Writer 4 this option can be found under Quiz Properties - Appearance Settings When the quiz taker enters text at the keyboard, the quiz can either use a system font or (with this option checked) an embedded font. Using an embedded font guarantees that the font will be used and the chosen characters will be available. You can ensure that all the letters and accents that a user might want to enter are embedded by choosing the right character set for the quiz taker's language. The embedded font is used in the Fill in the Blank and Essay style questions. It is also used when the user is prompted for Name/UserID at the start of the quiz. For text entry in Japanese and other languages with large character sets, it is usually better to switch off this option as the number of characters is very large and leads to a very large file size.
---- Go To [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Body_Text_Font|Body Text Font]], [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Title_Text_Font|Title Text Font]], [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Override_Feedback_Text_Colors|Override Feedback Text Colors]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Quiz Options/Text Settings/Body Text Font

revision.text:
==Body Text Font== In the '''Standard''' version of Question Writer 4 these options (apart from Override Body Text Font Color) can be found under Quiz Properties - Appearance Settings [[File:QW Body text font.jpg|center]] ===Override Body Text Font=== By ticking the box and selecting a font you can override the default font used in the theme, for example if you want to customize the appearance of the quiz ===Override Body Text Font Size=== You can override the default font size used in the body text. This might be useful eg if you have particularly long questions and have trouble fitting them on to a single page. ===Override Body Text Font Color=== {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" |'''Professional''' version users can override the default font color used in the theme body text.{{clr}} |}
---- Go To [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Text_Settings|Text Settings]], [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Title_Text_Font|Title Text Font]], [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Override_Feedback_Text_Colors|Override Feedback Text Colors]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Quiz Options/Text Settings/Title Text Font

revision.text:
==Title Text Font== If you are using the '''Standard''' version of Question Writer 4, these options (apart from the Override Title Text Font Color) can be found in Quiz Properties - Appearance Settings. [[Image:QW Title text font.jpg|center]] ===Override Title Text Font=== Each theme defines a different font to use in the quiz for titles - you can override that selection by choosing your own font here. ===Override Title Text Font Size=== As well as changing the font used you can also change the default font size for the titles. This could be useful eg if you want to display your quiz using an OHP and need to make sure everyone in the room can read the text. ===Override Title Text Font Color=== {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" |Quiz authors using the '''Professional''' version also have the option to change the color of the title text.{{clr}} |}
---- Go To [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Text_Settings|Text Settings]], [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Body_Text_Font|Body Text Font]], [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Text_Settings/Override_Feedback_Text_Colors|Override Feedback Text Colors]] {{BookCat}}

This can be useful if the default colors are not clearly seen against a customized quiz background.{{clr}} |} [[File:QW Override feedback text colors.jpg|center]]

{{Documentation subpage}} <!-- PLEASE ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE -->
This template is used to insert an empty, 1px wide, table cell into an HTML table or wikitable. It can be used whenever an empty cell is required to balance a table, for instance when hardcoding mbox templates.
This template takes no parameters.
=== Technical details ===
Most browsers are not so picky about balancing the table. However some are. For instance in Safari you can get partly missing left or right border of the table if some table rows do not contain the right number of table cells. <includeonly> <!-- CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS HERE, THANKS --> [[Category:Table formatting templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] </includeonly>

== {{SUBPAGENAME}} == __NOTOC__ <!-- don't delete this line, it contains housekeeping codes for your article -->
<!-- if you want to be listed as the author, replace this text and the enclosing angle brackets with "by __(your name here)__" -->
<!-- include the description of the exhibit here. Try to write this part as objectively as you can, keeping personal biases and opinions to a minimum -->
Two converted [[w:plug-in hybrid|plug-in]] Priuses and a CMT 380X Blackbird (using lithium iron phosphate batteries), the world's first plug-in hybrid sports car.
=== Maker(s) ===
<!-- include the names and contact information of the Maker(s) here -->
3prongPower, [mailto:info@3prongpower.com info@3prongpower.com] telephone 510-868-4133.
=== Impressions ===
<!-- include your point of view about the exhibit here. What did you like best about it? Out of respect for the Makers, please try to maintain a positive point of view: if you don't have anything good to say, please share constructive criticism only with the Maker(s) and not MakerFairePedia. Thank you! -->
This appeared to be the only exhibit of actual plug-in hybrids at the entire Faire, including by the major automakers with prototypes available. I hope they all offer lithium iron phosphate batteries.
=== External links ===
<!-- if you were able to find any URL(s) about the exhibit, please list them here, one per line, preceded by an asterisk ('*') -->

{{Infobox software | name = Perlwikibot | author = [[w:User:ST47|ST47]] | developer = The Perlwikibot team | released = August 25, 2007 | latest release version = 5.5.7 | latest release date = Nov 2013 | programming language = [[Subject:Perl programming language|Perl]] | license = [[w:GNU General Public License|GNU General Public License]] | website = http://perlwikipedia.googlecode.com }} ==What is this thing?== Perlwikibot is a bot framework, similar to [[Pywikibot]], except it's written in [[Subject:Perl programming language|Perl]]. ==Does that mean you're trying to make pywikibot obsolete?== Of course not! Pywikibot is a valuable bot framework (the Tawkerbot2 code, as well as most major bots, are written using it), however, if Perl coders are confined to using Python, they can't customize and extend the code to fit their needs. With an open-source framework written in their "native language," they'll be able to better write bots in a language that they are comfortable with, and even customize the framework to fit needs it wasn't originally imagined for. ==How complete is perlwikipedia?== Perlwikibot is almost completely cross-wiki, so you can write bots for virtually any [[MediaWiki]] wiki with it. As of version 5.005007, Perlwikibot does not support WikiData-specific queries or edits. ===Editing and querying wikis=== * Retrieve the wikitext of articles, sections, and old revisions * Edit pages * Retrieve the history of articles * Revert to old revisions of articles (manually, with undo, or with rollback) * Retrieve the [[Special:Recentchanges|Recent Changes]] log * Retrieve [[Special:WhatLinksHere|backlinks and transclusions]] * Purge page caches * Retrieve a listing of all pages in a category * Run [[Special:Linksearch|linksearches]] ===Admin functions=== * Deleting and undeleting pages * Blocking and unblocking users * Protecting and unprotecting pages * Performing transwiki imports (XML upload is in the works) == Installation == The [http://search.cpan.org/perldoc?MediaWiki::Bot latest stable version] can be installed from [[w:CPAN|CPAN]]: user@host:~$ cpan cpan> install MediaWiki::Bot ... Or download from [http://code.google.com/p/perlwikipedia/downloads/list] and install it like you would any other Perl module: perl Makefile.PL make make test sudo make install === Development versions === The latest unstable source code can be acquired from [https://github.com/MediaWiki-Bot/MediaWiki-Bot the github repo]. git clone https://github.com/MediaWiki-Bot/MediaWiki-Bot.git Unlike pywikibot, we ''do not'' recommend using the unstable source tree for production. ==Who wrote perlwikibot?== perlwikibot is maintained by [[w:User:ST47|ST47]], [[w:User:Shadow1|Shadow1]], [[w:User:Jmax-|Jmax-]], [[w:User:Oleg Alexandrov|Oleg Alexandrov]], and [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]. ==Can I help?== Sure! Check out the [https://openhatch.org/+projects/Perlwikibot OpenHatch page] for ways to get started, or jump into the [https://github.com/MediaWiki-Bot/MediaWiki-Bot/issues list of issues] and start hacking! {{BookCat}}

{{documentation subpage}} == Usage == {| style="float: left; border: none;" |
{{Infobox software
| name                   = 
| title                  = 
| logo                   = 
| screenshot             = 
| caption                = 
| collapsible            = 
| author                 = 
| developer              = 
| released               = 
| discontinued           = 
| latest release version = 
| latest release date    = 
| latest preview version = 
| latest preview date    = 
| frequently updated     = 
| programming language   = 
| operating system       = 
| platform               = 
| size                   = 
| language               =

}}
|} {{-}} == Example == {{Infobox software | name = Example: Yoyodyne | logo = | screenshot = [[File:Yoyo patent 1866.png|200px]] | caption = Yoyodyne v0.9 screenshot | developer = Yoyodyne Industries Inc. | released = {{Start date|1911}} | latest release version = 0.9 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2006|01|01}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | operating system = Unix-like | operating system desc = | size = 25MB | genre = Yoyonics | license = GNU General Public License | website = [http://www.example.org/ www.example.org] }} 
{{Infobox software
| name                   = Example: Yoyodyne
| logo                   = 
| screenshot             = [[File:Yoyo patent 1866.png|200px]]
| caption                = Yoyodyne v0.9 screenshot
| developer              = Yoyodyne Industries Inc.
| released               = {{Start date|1911}}
| latest release version = 0.9
| latest release date    = {{Start date and age|2006|01|01}}
| latest preview version = 
| latest preview date    = 
| operating system       = Unix-like
| operating system desc  = 
| size                   = 25MB
| genre                  = Yoyonics
| license                = GNU General Public License
| website                = [http://www.example.org/ www.example.org]
}}
== Parameters == All parameters are optional. ; name: name of software (Note: If you don't put the right thing here it breaks the latest release / latest preview fields when "frequently updated" is enabled. If you want the title at the top of the infobox to be different than the software templates, use the "title" parameter instead.) ; title: title ; logo: logo ; screenshot: screenshot image ; caption: caption for screenshot ; collapsible: can be set to "yes" in case of long vertical screenshot ; author: original author of the program ; developer: current developer of the program ; released: the release date of version 1.0 (or closely-matching release). For subsequent or prior releases, use latest release date.
Can use {{tl|Start date}} template. ; discontinued: whether this product is no longer being developed (changes the words 'Latest release' to 'discontinued). Any value will do, though 'yes' or 'true' are preferred for clarity. Use the last release version and date in the 'latest release' parameters, below. ; latest release version: latest released version number ; latest release date: release date of the latest released version; suggested use of {{tl|Start date and age}} template ; latest preview version: version number of preview version or development branch ; latest preview date: preview date; suggested use of {{tl|Start date and age}} template ; frequently updated: if set to "yes", latest release/preview date and version have to be defined in subtemplate by clicking the numbers directly in the infobox (make sure the "name" parameter above exactly matches the name of the subtemplate pages) ; programming language: programming language ; operating system: operating system. For Unix-like multi-OS programs use: Any Unix-like ; platform: (Java, .NET). For multi-platform programs use: Cross-platform ; size: in megabytes ; language: natural language (English, French) ; status: Should probably be one of: Planned, Active, Unmaintained, Discontinued, Abandonware ; genre: Type of program. Probably wikilinked to an article such as Geographic information system. ; license: License such as proprietary, GPL. Pick either ''license'' (American English) or ''licence'' (Commonwealth English), not both - select the one which matches the content of the article the template is used in. ; website: Web site of software package. [[Category:Infobox templates|Software]]

<includeonly>{{template doc page transcluded}}</includeonly><noinclude>{{template doc page viewed directly}}</noinclude> <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
==Usage== This template returns a date, or date-time. It also includes the same date (and time) duplicated in a hidden (by CSS) ISO date format, for use in [[w:microformat|microformat]]s. This hidden date degrades gracefully when CSS is not available.
==Syntax== *<nowiki>{{Start date|year|month|day}}</nowiki> *<nowiki>{{Start date|year|month|day|HH|MM|SS|TimeZone}}</nowiki> (MM and SS are optional; TimeZone may be a numerical value, or "Z" for [[w:Coordinated Universal Time|UTC]]; see examples)
Examples:
*<nowiki>{{Start date|1993}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|||+01:00}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|||+01:00}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|||-07:00}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|||-07:00}}" *:<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|23}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|23}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|23|Z}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|23|Z}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|23|+01:00}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|23|+01:00}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|23|-07:00}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|23|-07:00}}"
An optional parameter, df, can be set to "y" or "yes" (or indeed any value) to display the day before the month. This is primarily used in articles about events in parts of the world where the day precedes the month in a date.
Examples:
*<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|df=y}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|df=y}}" *<nowiki>{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|df=yes}}</nowiki> returns "{{Start date|1993|02|24|08|30|df=yes}}"
'''Note:''' The template will appear broken when the parameters are left blank (as seen above).
==See also== *{{tl|End date}} *{{tl|Start date and age}} <includeonly> <!-- ADD CATEGORIES BELOW THIS LINE --> [[Category:Date templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] <!-- ADD INTERWIKIS BELOW THIS LINE --> </includeonly>

revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} ===Syntax=== ;Full Syntax :'''{{((}}Start date and age''' {{!}}''yyyy'' {{!}}''mm'' {{!}}''dd'' [{{!}}df=yes] [{{!}}br=yes] '''{{))}}''' ;Notation #Character written in bold must be typed as shown #Words written in italic are names of parameters. They must be replaced with appropriate letters #Parameters enclosed in “[” and “]” are optional ;Description of Parameters :{| class="wikitable" |- ! Parameter ! Description |- |''yyyy'' |Four digits indicating the year in question. The year must always appear in a 4-digits form. |- |''mm'' |A number between 1 to 12, indicating the month. Leading zeros in the number are ignored. |- |''dd'' |A number between 1 to 31, indicating the day of the month. Leading zeros in the number are ignored. |- |'''df=''' |The optional parameter '''df''' can either be set to '''yes''' or anything other than '''yes'''. When set to '''yes''', date will be displayed in DMY format: Day appears to the left, month in the middle and year to the right. When set something other than '''yes''' or when this parameter is not included, date will be displayed in MD,Y format: Month appears to the left, day appears in the middle, a comma follows the day and finally year appears to the right. As for choosing the right format to use, consult [[Wikipedia:MOSNUM#Full date formatting|Manual of Style (dates and numbers): Full date formatting]]. |- |'''br=''' |The optional parameter '''br''' can either be set to '''yes''' or anything other than '''yes'''. When set to '''yes''', a line break will be inserted between the date and the age. When set something other than '''yes''' or when this parameter is not included, a breaking space will be inserted between the date and the age. In either case, a semicolon separates the date and age, immediately before the line break or space. |} ===Examples===
'''Syntax''' '''Result'''
{{Start date and age|2010|01|02}} {{Start date and age|2010|01|02}}
{{Start date and age|2008|08|09}} {{Start date and age|2008|08|09}}
{{Start date and age|2003|07|05}} {{Start date and age|2003|07|05}}
{{Start date and age|2010|1|2|df=yes}} {{Start date and age|2010|1|2|df=yes}}
{{Start date and age|2008|8|9|df=yes}} {{Start date and age|2008|8|9|df=yes}}
{{Start date and age|2003|7|5|df=yes}} {{Start date and age|2003|7|5|df=yes}}
{{Start date and age|2009|9|9|br=yes}} {{Start date and age|2009|9|9|br=yes}}
=== See also === *{{tl|End date}} *{{tl|Start date}} [[Category:Date templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

{{documentation subpage}} <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
=== Usage ===
This template returns a date, or date-time. It also include the same date (and time) duplicated in a hidden (by CSS) ISO date format, for use in [[w:microformat|microformat]]s. This hidden date degrades gracefully when CSS is not available.
===Syntax===
:<nowiki>{{End date|year|month|day}}</nowiki>
Examples:
*<nowiki>{{End date|1993|2|24}}</nowiki> returns "{{End date|1993|2|24}}" *<nowiki>{{End date|1993|2|24|08|30}}</nowiki> returns "{{End date|1993|2|24|08|30}}"
An optional parameter, df, can be set to "y" or "yes" (or indeed any value) to display the day before the month. This is primarily used in pages about events in parts of the world where the day precedes the month in a date.
Examples:
*<nowiki>{{End date|1993|2|24|df=yes}}</nowiki> returns "{{End date|1993|2|24|df=yes}}"
=== See also === *{{tl|Start date}} *{{tl|Start date and age}} <includeonly> <!-- ADD CATEGORIES BELOW THIS LINE --> [[Category:Date templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
<!-- ADD INTERWIKIS BELOW THIS LINE --> </includeonly>

{{#if:{{{df|}}}|{{#expr:{{{3}}}}} {{MONTHNAME|{{{2}}}}}|{{MONTHNAME|{{{2}}}}} {{#expr:{{{3}}}}},}} {{#expr:{{{1}}}}}({{{1}}}-{{padleft:{{MONTHNUMBER|{{{2}}}}}|2|0}}-{{padleft:{{{3}}}|2|0}}) {{Documentation|Template:Birth date and age/doc}}

{{Documentation subpage}} These templates ('''{{tl|Birth date}}''' and '''{{tl|Birth date and age}}''') return a person’s date of birth and optionally his/her age. Do NOT use this template when the person’s exact date of birth is disputed or unknown. Using this template rather than simply inserting the date into articles allows for the inclusion of hidden metadata about the date. This metadata can be used by web browsers and other software tools to extract the details, and display them using some other website or mapping tool, index or search them. === Syntax === ==== To display the birth date only ==== :{{Birth date|year of birth|month of birth|day of birth|additional parameters}} '''Do not use with non-Gregorian dates''' because the resulting hCard hidden date will be false. ==== To display a birth date with calculated age ==== :{{Birth date and age|year of birth|month of birth|day of birth|additional parameters}} '''This form is only intended for living persons.''' In the rare case that a living person's birth date is given in a non-Gregorian calendar this template should not be used. The parameter names 'year', 'month', and 'day' can be used instead of the first, second, and third parameters for 'Birth date and age' only. These parameter names are not available for the 'Birth date' template. Examples: :{{Birth date|1993|02|04|df=yes}} returns "{{Birth date|1993|02|04|df=yes}}" :{{Birth date|1993|02|04|mf=yes}} returns "{{Birth date|1993|02|04|mf=yes}}" :{{Birth date|1993|02|24|df=yes}} returns "{{Birth date|1993|02|24|df=yes}}" :{{Birth date|1993|02|24|mf=yes}} returns "{{Birth date|1993|02|24|mf=yes}}" :{{Birth date and age|1993|02|04|mf=yes}} returns {{Birth date and age|1993|02|04|mf=yes}} :{{Birth date and age|1993|02|04|df=yes}} returns {{Birth date and age|1993|02|04|df=yes}} :{{Birth date and age|1993|02|24|mf=yes}} returns {{Birth date and age|1993|02|24|mf=yes}} :{{Birth date and age|1993|02|24|df=yes}} returns {{Birth date and age|1993|02|24|df=yes}} === Month First (mf) and Day First (df) options === The '''df''' (day first) and '''mf''' (month first) parameters indicate the intended date format to display. The appropriate parameter should be set to "y" or "yes" e.g. '''df=yes''' or '''mf=y'''. The default output of this template is to display the month before the day. This default may not be appropriate for articles about people from parts of the world where the day precedes the month in a date. In such articles the parameter, "df", should be set to display the day before the month. The parameter "mf", while not actually used by the template, will indicate that month first format is intended. Using these parameters can assist bots or other automated processing to detect which date format is intended; leaving the format as default may lead an editor or bot to change the format to an unintended value. Do not specify both "df" and "mf" parameters in the same use of the template, as these formats are mutually exclusive. Examples: :{{Birth date|1993|02|24|df=yes}} displays "{{Birth date|1993|02|24|df=yes}}". :{{Birth date and age|1993|02|24|df=yes}} displays "{{Birth date and age|1993|02|24|df=yes}}". :{{Birth date|1993|02|24|mf=yes}} displays "{{Birth date|1993|02|24|mf=yes}}". :{{Birth date and age|1993|02|24|mf=yes}} displays "{{Birth date and age|1993|02|24|mf=yes}}". === See also === *{{tl|Death date and age}} – same as {{tl|Death date}}, except that "(aged ##)" appears after the death date *{{tl|Death date}} – displays the date and related hidden metadata [[Category:Date templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]

<includeonly>{{#expr:({{{4|{{CURRENTYEAR}}}}})-({{{1}}})-(({{{5|{{CURRENTMONTH}}}}})<({{{2}}})or({{{5|{{CURRENTMONTH}}}}})=({{{2}}})and({{{6|{{CURRENTDAY}}}}})<({{{3}}}))}}</includeonly><noinclude> {{documentation}}</noinclude>

{{documentation subpage}} <!-- EDIT TEMPLATE DOCUMENTATION BELOW THIS LINE -->
This template returns the number of full years between two specified dates. If the second set of parameters is not included, it will return the number of full years between a specified date and today's date.
;Syntax<nowiki>:</nowiki> :<nowiki>{{age|year1|month1|day1|year2|month2|day2}}</nowiki> or :<nowiki>{{age|year1|month1|day1}}</nowiki>
; Examples<nowiki>:</nowiki> : <nowiki>{{age|1989|7|23|2003|7|14}}</nowiki> returns "{{age|1989|7|23|2003|7|14}}" : <nowiki>{{age|1989|7|23}}</nowiki> returns "{{age|1989|7|23}}"
: When using this template to calculate a person's age at death or a person's age on a specified date (rather than the person's current age), please substitute it into the page. :: Example: <nowiki>{{subst:age|1989|7|23|2003|7|14}}</nowiki>
; Note<nowiki>:</nowiki> :This template does not check for incorrect input: :: <nowiki>{{age|1980|7|14|1993|6|233}}</nowiki> returns "{{age|1980|7|14|1993|6|233}}" (surplus days do not count as extra months) :: <nowiki>{{age|1980|7|14|1993|88|14}}</nowiki> returns "{{age|1980|7|14|1993|88|14}}" (surplus months do not count as extra years)
==See also== *{{tl|birth date and age}} — Displays birth date and age *{{tl|death date and age}} — Displays death date and age <includeonly> <!-- ADD CATEGORIES BELOW THIS LINE --> [[Category:Date templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
<!-- ADD INTERWIKIS BELOW THIS LINE -->
</includeonly>

revision.text:
{{Documentation subpage}} __NOTOC__ Returns a person's date of death and age at that date. Do NOT use this template when the person's exact date of birth or death is disputed or unknown. === Syntax === ==== To display the death date with age ==== : {{Death date and age|''year of death''|''month of death''|''day of death''|''year of birth''|''month of birth''|''day of birth''|''additional parameters''}} ; Format: : {{Death date and age|yyyy|mm|dd|yyyy|mm|dd|df=yes}} : {{Death date and age|yyyy|mm|dd|yyyy|mm|dd|mf=yes}} ==== Examples ==== : {{Death date and age|1993|2|24|1941|4|12|df=yes}}
returns {{Death date and age|1993|2|24|1941|4|12|df=yes}} : {{Death date and age|1993|2|24|1941|4|12|mf=yes}}
returns {{Death date and age|1993|2|24|1941|4|12|mf=yes}} '''Note''': The template will appear broken when the parameters are left blank. === Day First (df) and Month First options === The '''df''' (day first) parameter indicates the intended date format to display. It is switched on by setting it to "y" or "yes" e.g. '''df=yes''' or '''df=y'''. The default output of this template is the month before the day (American-based style). This default may not be appropriate in pages about people from parts of the world where the day precedes the month in a date (e.g. Europe). In such cases the parameter df should be set. It is possible to use similar parameter "mf" to stress the month-first format so that relying on the default does not lead an editor or bot to change the format to an unintended value; however, it is ignored by the template itself. (So, should both parameters be mistakenly used at once, df takes precedence.) Examples: :{{Death date and age|1993|2|24|1941|4|12|df=yes}}
displays "{{Death date and age|1993|2|24|1941|4|12|df=yes}}" :{{Death date and age|1993|2|24|1941|4|12|mf=yes}}
displays "{{Death date and age|1993|2|24|1941|4|12|mf=yes}}" === See also === * {{tl|Birth date}} * {{tl|Birth date and age}} – same as {{tl|Birth date}}, except that "(age ##)" appears after the death date * {{tl|Death date}} [[Category:Date templates|{{PAGENAME}}]]
<includeonly>{{#if:{{{df|}}}|{{#expr:{{{3}}}}} {{MONTHNAME|{{{2}}}}}|{{MONTHNAME|{{{2}}}}} {{#expr:{{{3}}}}},}} {{#expr:{{{1}}}}}</includeonly><noinclude> {{documentation}}</noinclude>

{{Documentation subpage}} <!-- PLEASE ADD CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS AT THE BOTTOM OF THIS PAGE --> __NOTOC__ Returns a person's date of death.
Using this template rather than simply inserting the date into articles allows for the inclusion of hidden metadata about the date. This metadata can be used by web browsers and other software tools to extract the details, and display them using some other website or mapping tool, index or search them.
===Syntax=== ====To display the death date only====
: <tt><nowiki>{{</nowiki>{{PAGENAME}}<nowiki>|</nowiki></tt>''year of death''<tt><nowiki>|</nowiki></tt>''month of death''<tt><nowiki>|</nowiki></tt>''day of death''<tt><nowiki>|</nowiki>''additional parameters''<nowiki>}}</nowiki></tt> where the month, day, and year are in the Gregorian calendar. '''Use of this template with non-Gregorian dates creates false hidden metadata.'''
====Examples==== :<nowiki>{{Death date|1993|2|4|df=yes}}</nowiki> returns "{{Death date|1993|2|4|df=yes}}" :<nowiki>{{Death date|1993|2|4|mf=yes}}</nowiki> returns "{{Death date|1993|2|4|mf=yes}}"
'''Note''': The template will appear broken when the parameters are left blank.
=== Day First (df) and Month First (mf) options=== The '''df''' (day first) and '''mf''' (month first) parameters indicate the intended date format to display. The appropriate parameter should be set to "y" or "yes" e.g. '''df=yes''' or '''mf=y'''.
The default output of this template is to display the month before the day (American-based style). This default may not be appropriate articles about people from parts of the world where the day precedes the month in a date (e.g. Europe). In such articles the parameter, "df", should be set to display the day before the month.
The parameter "mf" will indicate that month first format is intended. Using these parameters can assist [[WP:BOT|bots]] or other automated processing to detect which date format is intended; leaving the format as default may lead an editor or bot to change the format to an unintended value.
Do not specify both "df" and "mf" parameters in the same use of the template, as these formats are mutually exclusive.
Examples:
:<nowiki>{{Death date | 1993 | 2 | 24 | df=yes }}</nowiki> displays "24 February 1993". :<nowiki>{{Death date | 1993 | 2 | 24 | mf=yes }}</nowiki> displays "February 24, 1993".
=== See also === *{{tl|Birth date}} *{{tl|Birth date and age}} – same as {{tl|Birth date}}, except that "(age ##)" appears after the death date *{{tl|Death date and age}} – same as {{tl|Death date}}, except that "(aged ##)" appears after the death date <includeonly> <!-- CATEGORIES AND INTERWIKIS HERE, THANKS --> [[Category:Date templates|{{PAGENAME}}]] </includeonly>

In Fact, the annotated code on the eclipselink implementation did not generate FKs btw the entity table and the collection table. I wonder why it happens. By the way, no PK is generated either, what can be a headache if you intend to design the database from the ORM mappings....
:Foreign key constraints should be generated, although the JPA does not require this (or schema creation in general). Sounds like a bug in EclipseLink's schema creation. Please log a bug on EclipseLink for this. As for the primary keys, JPA does not define an Id for Embeddables, so defining a primary key would be difficult. EclipseLink does allow defining a primary key on Embeddables used in an ElementCollection, so this may work. :: [[User:Jamesssss|James]] ([[User talk:Jamesssss|talk]]) 12:48, 31 May 2010 (UTC)

I am considering adding a section explaining how \include{file} compared to \input{file} allows one to reference between different included files. Input file does not allow this, good information at [http://web.science.mq.edu.au/~rdale/resources/writingnotes/latexstruct.html web.science.mq.edu.au]. [[User:Keplerspeed|Keplerspeed]] ([[User talk:Keplerspeed|talk]]) 00:32, 25 May 2010 (UTC) Keplerspeed 25/05/2010 : That's rather important piece of information. It would also be good to link to it from [[LaTeX/Basics]] [[User:Tomato86|Tomato86]] ([[User talk:Tomato86|talk]]) 22:29, 22 July 2010 (UTC) :: I removed all the \input and \include stuff from the Basic section, as it was a less detailed duplicate of the current chapter. I just left the link to this part. --[[User:Ambrevar|Ambrevar]] ([[User talk:Ambrevar|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Ambrevar|contribs]]) 14:28, 21 December 2012 (UTC)
== Section on calling files in other directories ==
I wonder if this section should not be moved to a separate item, since the information contained here is common to any command which calls another file (e.g. graphicx commands)? Also, the reference to *nix may be too cryptic for some of the readership this manual addresses. This section could thus be reduced to a single-sentence reference to a more complete and generally useful section. [[User:Ediahist|Ediahist]] ([[User talk:Ediahist|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Ediahist|contribs]]) 12:42, 14 July 2011 (UTC)
==Sub folders issue== Trying to implement subfiles example I encounter a problem. If you put your subfiles in subdirectories e.g. chapter 1, chapter 2 etc and use this subfiles to call subsubfiles (this may seem peculiar but it normal if you have a plot in chapter 1 and want to call it with \includegraphics{./plot.pdf}) when you try to compile the chapter 1 tex file it works ok but if you go on and try to compile the main tex file you will end up with an error "./plot.pdf" not found. This is most probably because the main tex file and the chapter1.tex are in different directories.
==Moved chapter== This chapter was previously called General Guidelines and I could never figure out what it was supposed to contain, I renamed it to Modular Documents, which is actually 95% of the chapter. I moved the last 5% (the last paragraph) to the programming part. I left a link to the Macros chapter in the Basic chapter so that first time readers will get to know how much macros are important. --[[User:Ambrevar|Ambrevar]] ([[User talk:Ambrevar|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Ambrevar|contribs]]) 14:28, 21 December 2012 (UTC)
== Should there be information about installing LaTeX packages here? ==
It just seems a little out of scope to describe how to install some suggested packages.[[User:Nixphoeni|Nixphoeni]] ([[User talk:Nixphoeni|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Nixphoeni|contribs]]) 16:06, 8 April 2014 (UTC)
== document.tex ==
What is the advantage of putting
\usepackage{graphicx} \usepackage{ifpdf} \ifpdf % put here packages only for the PDF: \DeclareGraphicsExtensions{.pdf,.png,.jpg,.mps} \usepackage{hyperref} \else % put here packages only for the DVI: \fi
in document.tex file instead of the mystyle.sty file? [[User:Howeworth|Howeworth]] ([[User talk:Howeworth|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Howeworth|contribs]]) 21:23, 19 August 2014 (UTC)

== Suggestion - content from FLOSS Manuals ==
It might be a good idea to incorporate data from [http://en.flossmanuals.net/Blender/Introduction| this FLOSS Manual]. It's GPL, so that shouldn't be a problem. The [http://wiki.blender.org/index.php/Main_Page| Blender Wiki] could also be useful, and it's under the Open Content License. [[User:Trebawa|Trebawa]] ([[User talk:Trebawa|talk]]) 01:42, 25 May 2010 (UTC)

revision.text: {{Foreign Alphabet/Navigation (Greek)}} In this lession you'll learn five Greek letters. {| class="wikitable" ! English name !! Greek letter !! Pronunciation |- ||| Νν || '''N'''ew |- | Tav || Ττ || '''T'''ime |- | || Ηη || |- | || Χχ || |- | Pi || Ππ || '''P'''i.e. |}

==Software Version==
It is unclear what version of the program is being used here; the screenshot looks slightly different from my install of 0.46 (but that could just be OS/personal preference differences). I think there is a need for guidelines with respect to software versions (especially unfinished software) and guides to said software. With 0.47 out now a lot of information will become obsolete or inaccurate, and this is a potential problem that can be prevented with proper guidelines. I'm going to start a discussion on this in the reading room as well. --[[User:Xerol|Xerol Oplan]] ([[User talk:Xerol|talk]]) 02:30, 25 May 2010 (UTC)
== Moving the toolbars == There is no mention on how to dock the toolbars. I'm using 0.48 and can't do this after I undock them.

I am not sure if this would fit any criteria for speedy del (I am aware that we shouldn't accept strategy guides, but that does not seem to be what the author wants to do). Assuming the subject can be deemed within scope this looks like a valid stub to me. I would give the author a chance to see exactly where he wants to get. By the way: I don't think the redlinks mentioned at the edit summary were "joke links", but rather a naive way of adding emphasis to words. --[[User:Duplode|Duplode]] ([[User talk:Duplode|talk]]) 03:02, 25 May 2010 (UTC)
:I agree that it doesn't seem to completely fall under anything in [[WB:SPEEDY]]. Specifically, under criteria #5 it should go to [[WB:RFD|RFD]], but on the other hand it's ''not actually CSD'd yet''. Granted, it doesn't seem like this module has much hope so maybe it should go to RFD sooner, but the template used does give 7 days before it gets CSD'd and it's only been a bit more than 2. [[User:Xerol|Xerol Oplan]] ([[User talk:Xerol|talk]]) 03:13, 25 May 2010 (UTC)
::The page was queried less than a hour after creation, and a book about RPGs probably could be within scope (say, by providing and overview of the types of pen-and-paper and video game RPGs and their usual conventions). I feel it would be fair to give the newbie author a chance to develop it, so I removed the query. (I watchlisted the page to remind myself of RfDing it in case the author disappears leaving just this stub behind) --[[User:Duplode|Duplode]] ([[User talk:Duplode|talk]]) 03:37, 25 May 2010 (UTC)

The pages should still be linked somewhere in page/book text or a TOC.</small> - '''[[User:Xerol|Xerol]]''' ''<sup>[[User talk:Xerol|talk]]</sup>''

I have reverted the status of this wikibook to 75% after it was changed. Looking at the todo list, the purpose of the wikibook, the title of the wikibook and the state of the wikibook I remain convinced that this is the correct status. Wikibooks are collective efforts, so while I initiated this book; designed it; wrote most of the content, I understand that others may take different views. Could I ask that if the status is changed the wikipedian *explains* the change so that I can understand why I should revert it to reflect my view of the completion status? Thanks [[User:Jimbotyson|Jimbotyson]] ([[User talk:Jimbotyson|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Jimbotyson|contribs]]) 10:05, 19 July 2011 (UTC)

page.title: Pictures of Julia and Mandelbrot Sets/Favourite formulas

revision.comment: moved [[Pictures of Julia and Mandelbrot sets/Favourite formulas]] to [[Pictures of Julia and Mandelbrot Sets/Favourite formulas]]: [[Wikibooks:Naming policy]]
revision.text:
If you insert a random complex rational function in a fractal program, it is very unlikely that you will find an interesting locality in the Mandelbrot set. But sometimes you will witness a startling spectacle when you zoom in. And this is usually where two domains of different structures meet each other.
If you come across an interesting formula, then let the rest of us see it. You can here write the formula and the coordinates of the locality, and show a picture. You should also state the critical points, however you can neglect this, if you use ∞ and a real point of smallest numerical value, or if you (in case of iterations towards finite cycles) use two conjugate complex numbers of largest distance.
You should fell free to remove formulas that clearly have been surpassed by others.
:<math>z^2/2 + z^4/4 + c</math> c = (0.7, 1.3) :<math>1 - z^2 + z^5/(2 + 4z) + c</math> c = (-0.163, 0.085)
<gallery>
Image:Juliasetsdkpictformula1.jpg|The Mandelbrot set for <math>z^2/2 + z^4/4 + c</math> Image:Juliasetsdkpictformula2.jpg|The Mandelbrot set for <math>1 - z^2 + z^5/(2 + 4z) + c</math>
</gallery> {{BookCat}}

page.title: Dichterliebe/Und wüßten's die Blumen, die kleinen

revision.comment: /* Das ist ein Flöten und Geigen */
revision.text:
===Und wüßten's die Blumen, die kleinen=== {| ! Original German (Song 8) ! English Translation (Poem XXII) |- | style="padding-right: 0.5em;" | <source lang="text" enclose="none">
Und wüßten's die Blumen, die kleinen, wie tief verwundet mein Herz, sie würden mit mir weinen zu heilen meinen Schmerz.
Und wüßten's die Nachtigallen, wie ich so traurig und krank, sie ließen fröhlich erschallen erquickenden Gesang.
Und wüßten sie mein Wehe, die goldenen Sternelein, sie kämen aus ihrer Höhe, und sprächen Trost mir ein.
Die alle können's nicht wissen, nur Eine kennt meinen Schmerz; sie hat ja selbst zerrissen, zerrissen mir das Herz. </source>
| style="padding-right: 0.5em;" |
<source lang="text" enclose="none"> And if they knew it, the blooms, the little ones, how deeply wounded my heart is, they would weep with me to heal my pain.
And if they knew it, the nightingales, how I am so sad and sick, they would loose the merry sound of refreshing song.
And if they knew my pain, the golden little stars, they would descend from their heights and would comfort me.
All of them cannot know it, only one knows my pain, she herself has indeed torn, torn up my heart. </source>
|}
==Lotte Lehmann's Advice==

|current=Input-Output Analysis M File
|previous=Topic: Input-Output Analysis
|next=Topic: Accuracy of Computations}}</noinclude>
<source lang="matlab" enclose="none">
# Octave commands for _Linear Algebra_ by Jim Hefferon,
#  Topic: leontif.tex 
a=[(25448-5395)/25448  -2664/30346;
    -48/25448          (30346-9030)/30346];
b=[17589;
   21243];
ans=a \ b;
printf("The answer to the first system is s=%0.0f and a=%0.0f\n",ans(1),ans(2));
b=[17489;
   21243];
ans=a \ b;
printf("The answer to the second system is s=%0.0f and a=%0.0f\n",ans(1),ans(2));
# question 1
b=[17789;
   21243];
ans=a \ b;
printf("The answer to question (1a) is s=%0.0f and a=%0.0f\n",ans(1),ans(2));
b=[17689;
   21443];
ans=a \ b;
printf("The answer to question (1b) is s=%0.0f and a=%0.0f\n",ans(1),ans(2));
b=[17789;
   21443];
ans=a \ b;
printf("The answer to question (1c) is s=%0.0f and a=%0.0f\n",ans(1),ans(2));
# question 2
printf("Current ratio for use of steel by auto is %0.4f\n",2664/30346);
a=[(25448-5395)/25448  -0.0500;
    -48/25448          (30346-9030)/30346];
b=[17589;
   21243];
ans=a \ b;
printf("The answer to 2(a) is s=%0.0f and a=%0.0f\n",ans(1),ans(2));
b=[17589;
   21500];
ans=a \ b;
printf("The answer to 2(b) is s=%0.0f and a=%0.0f\n",ans(1),ans(2));
# question 3
printf("The value of steel used by others is %0.2f\n",18.69-(6.90+1.28));
printf("The value of autos used by others is %0.2f\n",14.27-(0+4.40));
a=[(18.69-6.90)/18.69  -1.28/14.27;
    -0/18.69          (14.27-4.40)/14.27];
b=[1.10*(18.69-(6.90+1.28));
   1.15*(14.27-(0+4.40))];
ans=a \ b;
printf("The answer to 3(a) is s=%0.2f and a=%0.2f\n",ans(1),ans(2));
printf("The 1947 ratio of steel used by steel is %0.2f\n",(18.69-6.90)/18.69);
printf("The 1947 ratio of steel used by autos is %0.2f\n",1.28/14.27);
printf("The 1947 ratio of autos used by steel is %0.2f\n",0/18.69);
printf("The 1947 ratio of autos used by autos is %0.2f\n",(14.27-4.40)/14.27);
printf("The 1958 ratio of steel used by steel is %0.2f\n",(25448-5395)/25448);
printf("The 1958 ratio of steel used by autos is %0.2f\n",2664/30346);
printf("The 1958 ratio of autos used by steel is %0.2f\n",48/25448);
printf("The 1958 ratio of autos used by autos is %0.2f\n",(30346-9030)/30346);
b=[17.598/1.30;
   21.243/1.30];
ans=a \ b;
newans=1.30 * ans;
printf("The answer to 3(c) is (in billions of 1947 dollars) s=%0.2f and a=%0.2f\n  and in billions of 1958 dollars it is s=%0.2f and a=%0.2f\n",ans(1),ans(2),newans(1),newans(2));
</source>

Now I can see that it is asking me to add license information to the file to prevent it from getting deleted, but I am not able to do that. Please help me. I donot want the file to get deleted. Thanks [[User:Abhinavagarwal2010|Abhinavagarwal2010]] ([[User talk:Abhinavagarwal2010|talk]]) 20:48, 11 April 2010 (UTC)Abhinavagarwal2010 :If you take a look at [[WB:MEDIA]], you will see information on the basics. You can see the full list of license tags at [[commons:Commons:Copyright tags|Commons:Copyright tags]]. Be sure to do that at [[commons:File:Shekar.jpg]] and not at Wikibooks, though. In the future, the upload wizard at Commons will help you to select the correct license automatically. If you can't figure out the license that applies, you can ask the experts at [[commons:Commons:Help desk|Commons:Help desk]]. I hope that gets you pointed in the right direction. -- [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Adrignola|contribs]] 22:51, 11 April 2010 (UTC) == Spam for overnightpools.com == Unregistered user [[Special:Contributions/208.75.10.42|208.75.10.42]] has repeatedly added this link in spite of being warned. Uploading files to [[commons:|Commons]] can be done immediately. -- [[User:Adrignola|Adrignola]] [[User talk:Adrignola|talk]] [[Special:Contributions/Adrignola|contribs]] 17:33, 30 April 2010 (UTC)

revision.text:
In this topic, students learn and enhance their knowledge about how to be an astronaut! Yes, they will be taught about that cool suit they will wear and the great feelings and experiences of landing on such surfaces like the moon. However, this topic contains an element of challenge as students are encouraged to research an astronaut and then give extended responses on their favourite type of chocolate cake. Yum, cake.
